isis.stitle: Pre-Delivery Inspection Master Instruction Manual - INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS

svcproc.title: INSPECTION INSTRUCTIONS
svcproc.para: 1.10 Research VIN for Recalls / Updates

item.para: Indicate on Pre-Delivery Inspection Report the vehicle Model, PDI Facility Name and Location, VIN, R.O. No. (if applicable), Customer Name and Location.
Check for open AFC's and open Recalls on ISIS. Go To ISIS Vehicle Information page.
Enter Chassis Number (Last 8 Digits of VIN)
Check under Uptime Information for open Recalls and Open AFC's.
On the same page check Calibration Status link for required engine updates and ESC updates.
Document updates, any open Recalls, open AFC's, or UpTime issues in COMMENTS section of PDI Report Form.

svcproc.para: 1.20 Prepare Vehicle for PDI - Wheel Chocks

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, chock the wheels and turn the engine off.

note.para: PDI should take place in a well-lit location with a smooth level floor (a slight grade for water drainage is acceptable) to assure accurate fluid level checks.

item.para: Assure vehicle has 115+ psi air pressure in the brake system per the dash gauges.
Turn OFF key.
Install wheel chocks to prevent vehicle movement forward or backward.
On air brake vehicles, release parking brake to pressurize parking brake release circuit to assist in leak detection.
Cover seats (if uncovered) and floor mat with protective coverings to protect them from dirt during PDI.

note.para: It is recommended that clean shop floor mats made of cloth material be placed on the shop floor just outside the vehicle's cab doors to reduce the amount of dirt tracked into the vehicle interior.

svcproc.para: 3.10 Disable Hybrid System - PEC switch
Disable the Eaton HEV system by pushing in the button located on the HEV battery box.
3.20 Hybrid Service Disconnect OFF and LOCKED (Enova HEV)

item.para: Locate the Hybrid Service Disconnect Switch on the Enova Battery Packs (one per pack).
Disconnect the Service Disconnect Switches and lock them out with a padlock. Keep the key with you in order to ensure your safety during the PDI inspection process.

svcproc.para: 3.30 Charge Battery - Auto Max. Charge - 2 hr minimum*

* Unless Midtronics 55 amp Smart Charger is used and light on charger goes to continuous (not flashing) green in less than 2 hours. It is still recommended to keep the battery charger connected both before and after the Road Test due to the high likelihood of current draw with engine OFF during the inspection.
FOR 12V PARALLEL SYSTEMS

item.para: Carefully connect smart battery charger and charge batteries for a minimum of 2 hours.*
Turn charger ON at 12V automatic high rate of charge. Watch for Incorrect Hook-Up warning.
Continue to charge the batteries until the green LED illuminates continuously. Continue charging after Road Test if necessary.

note.para: If batteries are cool [less than 60 deg F (16 deg C)], moving vehicle into a heated facility will shorten charging time required. It may take up to 20 hours to achieve a full charge if the batteries are charged in a very cold [0 deg F (-17 deg C)] environment.
For further details see the Smart Charger operator's manual on ISIS website at: https://evalue.internationaldelivers.com/service/spectools/PowerCharge.pdf

svcproc.para: 3.32 IVEST Battery and Alternator Test Successful

item.para: Verify documentation states that vehicle has successfully passed the factory IVEST test for Battery and Alternator performance.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 3.40 Batteries, Cables, Cover - routing, tight, greased

item.para: Battery cable end connections in box should be tight and secure.
Battery cable end connections should be protected by a dielectric grease.
Cables are not kinked, crimped, pinched or rubbing when box moves.
Batteries are securely fastened in box.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 3.50 Install loose components shipped for or with the vehicle

item.para: These include:
Tailpipes/ Vertical exhaust stacks should be fully inserted into exhaust pipe
Exhaust stacks should be properly aligned if applicable
Clamps should be tight and secure, and installed in overlapping area between upper and lower stacks
Torque Specifications:
Aluminized band, bright hardware - 44 to 59 ft-lbs.
409 Stainless band, dull gray hardware - 35 to 46 ft-lbs.
If in doubt, torque to 46 ft-lbs.
Correct as needed.

NOTE: Vehicle transport personnel frequently install tailpipes. Therefore vehicles arriving with tailpipes installed should be inspected for proper tailpipe installation / bolt torques/ etc. Tailpipe installation and alignment labor is included in the PDI. Any damages to parts should be noted at the time of the receipt of the vehicle and charged to the vehicle transport service.
Trailer connections
CB antennas
Mud flaps
Cargo nets
Any other mounted/installed component shipped with the vehicle and not installed by the plant.
Document items to be repaired/ missing parts on PDI Report.

NOTE: Labor cost for air deflector installation and additional dealer added / installed components is not part of the PDI but is to be charged to the vehicle's cost via the assigned Stock Unit# / VIN / Tag# / Etc.

svcproc.para: 3.60 Mud flaps / Fenders - secure, aligned, clears exhaust

item.para: Mud flaps should be securely mounted.
Fenders should be properly aligned with vehicle body.
Mud flaps should not hit exhaust tailpipe.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

note.para: Labor for the installation and inspection of dealer supplied mudflaps is not covered under PDI.

svcproc.para: 5.10 Routing and clipping under vehicle - secured, meets specs

item.para: Check the following items:
Electrical wiring harnesses
Battery cables
Air hoses
Fuel hoses
Coolant/heater hoses
Power steering hoses
Transmission cooler / retarder lines
Refrigerant hoses
Added hydraulic equipment / hosing.
All cables, hoses, and wires should be:
Well supported every 24" (600 mm) or less
Free from tension
5" (125 mm) from any heat source unless shielded
3" (75 mm) from any heat source if shielded
Clear from any rub or pinch point
Free from kinking or pinching
Should NOT block access to any fluid fill, fluid drain, or inspection points
Compressor discharge line should be free from any low points, or "water traps"
Listen for audible air leaks (and optionally the Ultrasonic Leak Detector if desired). Spray a liquid soap solution on any suspect air connections. Bubbles indicate a leak.
Correct minor routing and clipping problems using tie wraps as needed during PDI.
NOTE:Cost of tie wraps and labor is included in PDI. Do not file for additional PTD Warranty.
Document items to be corrected on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.11 Undercoating - no bare spots

item.para: Undercoating must cover entire underside of body.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.12 Body Tie-Down clips - not hanging loose

item.para: Verify visually the locations of Body Tie-Down Clips and verify none are hanging loose.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.15 Drive Wheel Hub Gear Cases Oil Level - FULL

item.para: Oil level on oil-filled rear drive gear case hubs should be at or above the "OIL LEVEL" / "MINIMUM LEVEL" line on the view window, and be below the vent plug opening. Oil should not pour out if the rubber cap is removed.
Add or remove oil as needed during PDI to bring level to the proper range on the hub.
Verify that drain plug is snug and leak-free.

svcproc.para: NOTE : If fluid level is within specified operating range, further fluid additions are not necessary and are not covered by PTD Warranty. Only fluid added, not labor, is covered by PTD Warranty.
5.20 Rearmost Drive Shaft U-joints - in-phase, retorque*
*Retorque not required for BE, CE, FE, RE Bus.

item.para: Verify that the rearmost 2 driveshaft joints are in alignment with each other.
If required, realign driveshaft U-Joints as part of PDI.

svcproc.para: NOTE: Retorque as specified using new bolts and collars.
NOTE: The chances of driveshaft phase angle misalignment is greater on vehicles that have had their driveshaft disconnected during new vehicle delivery.
5.30 Shock Absorbers / Bump Stops - secure

item.para: Verify that shock absorbers are securely installed
Verify that bump stops are securely installed.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.35 Slack Adjusters - (Stroke <1.75" STD, <2.0" LS)*

* Specs listed in Task title are the most conservative and will work for all brake chambers. They are listed as a quick reference for convenience. Maximum acceptable legal chamber stroke specifications may be longer for larger brake chambers. Refer to the chart below.

table.title: Maximum Legal Brake Slack Adjuster/ Chamber Stroke

entry.para: Maximum Stroke with Standard Stroke Brake Chamber (inches)
Maximum Stroke with Long Stroke Brake Chamber (inches)

item.para: Inspect the Brake Slack Adjuster/ Chamber Stroke at 90 to 100 PSI application pressure (not more or less) to assure it is less than the specifications shown in the chart above.
If stroke exceeds the specification listed or over-stroke indicator is visible, brake chambers are over-stroking and slack adjusters must be adjusted.
Document items to be adjusted on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.36 Drive Shaft Guards - secure, aligned

item.para: Verify that the Drive Shaft Guards cannot be moved by hand and that they are installed perpendicular to the driveshaft.
Assure the Drive Shaft Guards are more than 1 inch away from the drive shaft at any point.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.40 Center Bearing - alignment - square and tight

item.para: Verify that center bearing isolator is not out of carrier alignment.
Verify that center bearing assembly mounting bolts are tight.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.45 Exhaust - secure, position, tailpipe end location

item.para: Exhaust system should be securely mounted to frame.
Exhaust system joints should be tight and leak free. Look for evidence of leakage such as soot or slobber around the joints.
Exhaust system sensors, cables, tubes, and hoses should be tension free and should not rub any object.
Exhaust tailpipe must terminate at DOT or State specified location or range.
Exhaust tailpipe must not contact mud flaps or other non-exhaust components.
Exhaust tailpipe must not exit within 12" laterally from any fuel fill point.
Exhaust pipes routed through the bumper must be adjusted so that the tailpipe is centered in the bumper opening and that no portion of the pipe is in contact with the bumper.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.50 Air Tank Drain Valves - activate

item.para: All air tank drain valves must function properly.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.55 Drive Shaft Drop Box Oil Level - FULL - torque both plugs

item.para: Verify that oil level is filled level with fill port. Add fluid as needed.
Verify that the fill plug and the drain plug are torqued to spec. and leak-free.

svcproc.para: 5.60 Transfer Case Oil Level - FULL - torque both plugs

item.para: Verify that oil level is filled level with fill port. Add fluid as needed.
Verify that the fill plug and the drain plug are torqued to spec. and leak-free.

svcproc.para: 5.65 Manual Transmission Oil Level - FULL - torque both plugs

item.para: Verify that oil level is filled level with bottom of the fill plug opening. Add fluid as needed.
NOTE: Be sure to top off with the correct fluid type (synthetic/ conventional mineral oil) per Lineset Ticket, Job Information Sheet, or label on fill plug.
Allow an overfilled transmission to drain excess fluid.
Verify that the fill plug and the drain plug are torqued to spec. and leak-free.

svcproc.para: NOTE: Labor is covered within PDI. Fluid added is covered under PTD Warranty.
5.70 Manual Transmission Oil Level within 1/8" (3 mm) of fill opening

item.para: Verify that oil level in transmission is at or within 1/8 inch (3 mm) of the bottom of the fill plug opening.
NOTE: Fluid level is acceptable if fluid level is not more than 1/8 inch (3 mm) below the bottom of the fill hole opening. Further fluid additions are not covered by PTD Warranty.
If the fluid is more than 1/8 inch (3 mm) below the bottom of the fill plug opening, add more fluid until the oil is filled level with the bottom of the fill plug opening.
Allow an overfilled transmission to drain excess fluid.
Verify that the fill plug and the drain plug are torqued to spec. and leak-free.

svcproc.para: NOTE: Labor is covered within PDI. Fluid added is covered under PTD Warranty.
5.75 Trans cooler line connector gage clips - (4) installed

item.para: Verify that all (up to four) Snap-To-Connect (STC) fitting gage clips are installed on both ends of the two Transmission Oil Cooler hoses to assure the STC fittings are fully latched.

If the STC fitting gage clips are not present, verify that the cooler hose sections are fully latched by grasping the tubing on each side of the connections and forcefully pushing the connectors together. Then pull forcefully on each side of the connection in order to assure that they are fully connected.

para.emph: CAUTION - Failure to fully latch the STC fittings can allow the fittings to come apart during use, resulting in transmission failure due to oil loss.

item.para: Document any missing clips that need to be added on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.76 Trans cooler line connector gage clips - (2) installed

item.para: Verify that all Snap-To-Connect (STC) fitting gage clips are installed on radiator end of the two Transmission Oil Cooler hoses to assure the STC fittings are fully latched.

If the STC fitting gage clips are not present, verify that the cooler hose sections are fully latched by grasping the tubing on each side of the connections and forcefully pushing the connectors together. Then pull forcefully on each side of the connection in order to assure that they are fully connected.

para.emph: CAUTION - Failure to fully latch the STC fittings can allow the fittings to come apart during use, resulting in transmission failure due to oil loss.

item.para: Document any missing clips that need to be added on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.80 Cotter keys / lock tabs spread - steering / brakes

item.para: Verify cotter pins or lock tabs are present and spread.
Document, on PDI Report, missing or damaged cotter keys or lock tabs to be corrected.

svcproc.para: 5.85 Starter, Ground Connections - tight, greased

item.para: Inspect cable end tightness. Connections should be tight and coated with dielectric grease.
Cable ends make no contact with other vehicle hardware.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.90 Lubricate chassis - zerks, door/ bumper hinges

item.para: Lubricate all grease zerks (typically a quantity of 33 total zerks) including:
King Pins (4 zerks) and King Pin Thrust Bearings (2) with vehicle weight on tires
Tie Rod Ends (2)
Drag Link Ends (2)
Steering Intermediate Shaft (2) U-Joints and (1) Slip Joint
NOTE: Synthetic Mobilith 100 Grease part number 2595564C1 must be used on 16-spline PROStar steering intermediate shaft slip joint (See TSI 07-05-01). 6-spline shafts may use normal chassis grease.
Steering Gear Dust Seal (1) (Not present on some steering gears.)

para.emph: CAUTION: Only use a hand-operated grease gun on Steering Gear Dust Seal grease zerk (if present)! Using a power grease gun will blow out the seal!

item.para: Brake Cam Shafts (6) on 6x4, (4) on 4x2
Brake Slack Adjusters (6) on 6x4, (4) on 4x2
Drive Shaft U-Joints (2 to 5) (10-Series Drive Shafts Only!)
Drive Shaft Slip Joints (2) on 6x4, (1) on 4x2 (10-Series Drive Shafts Only!)

NOTE:DO NOT add grease to SPL XL Drive Shaft (easily identified by having a plastic bellows covering the slip joints). It has synthetic lube from the factory. The zerks are covered with plastic caps which should be left in place. Only grease "10-Series" Drive Shafts.
Transmission Clutch Cross Shaft Bushings (2)
Transmission Clutch Throw-out Bearing (1)
5th Wheel Pivot Pins (0 to 4)
5th Wheel Slider Mechanism (0 to 4)
5th Wheel Top Plate and Locking Jaw (additional details covered in separate 5th Wheel line item)
Lubricate Door Hinges and Door Check-Links with spray white Lithium grease.
Lubricate Bumper hinges with spray white Lithium grease.

svcproc.para: NOTE: Labor and cost of Lubricant materials to lubricate chassis are included within PDI. Do not include in PTD Warranty.
5.92 Joints Lubricated - verify zerks and doors lubed

item.para: Verify all grease zerks are installed and have received lubricant including (if applicable):
King Pins (4 zerks) and King Pin Thrust Bearings (2) with vehicle weight on tires
Tie Rod Ends (2)
Drag Link Ends (2)
Steering Intermediate Shaft (2) U-Joints and (1) Slip Joint
Brake Cam Shafts (6) on 6x4, (4) on 4x2
Brake Slack Adjusters (6) on 6x4, (4) on 4x2
Drive Shaft U-Joints (2 to 5) (10-Series Drive Shafts Only!)
Drive Shaft Slip Joints (2) on 6x4, (1) on 4x2 (10-Series Drive Shafts Only!)

NOTE:DO NOT add grease to SPL XL Drive Shaft (easily identified by having a plastic bellows covering the slip joints). It has synthetic lube from the factory. The zerks are covered with plastic caps which should be left in place. Only grease "10-Series" Drive Shafts.
Transmission Clutch Cross Shaft Bushings (2)
Transmission Clutch Throw-out Bearing (1)
5th Wheel Pivot Pins (0 to 4)
5th Wheel Slider Mechanism (0 to 4)
5th Wheel Top Plate and Locking Jaw (additional details covered in separate 5th Wheel line item)
Door hinge zerks
Verify Door Hinges and Door Check-Links have been lubricated.
Lube missed joints or document items that still need to be lubed on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 5.95 Axle Spring U-bolts - retorque (See Torque Chart)
7.10 Chassis Air Suspension Ride Height - (set to spec)

item.para: Refer to TSI 06-03-01 for specifications.
Document items to be repaired/ adjusted on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 7.15 Fifth Wheel - lubed, functions, secured
NOTE: Labor and cost of Lubricant materials to lubricate chassis/ 5th wheel are included within PDI. Do not include in PTD Warranty.

item.para: Refer to the correct operator's manual for proper lubrication procedures.

Lubricate 5th Wheel Top Plate and Locking Jaw, if applicable. On Fontaine 5th wheels, close the jaw by pushing forward on the lower section of the jaw with a long shaft and then separate the locking jaw from the wedge with a screwdriver and install grease into the gap so that the contact surface between the two parts is well lubricated. This will keep the two parts from sticking together and locking-up the jaw mechanism later.
Fifth wheel should lock / unlock smoothly and fully.
NOTE: Activate hand-operated Jaw Release (and electrically operated feature if present).
Sliding fifth wheel should be secure and tight in locked position.
Document major component issues to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 7.20 Pintle Hook - locks, releases, secure

item.para: Pintle hook and mounting hardware should be tight and secure.
Pintle hook should release and open easily.
Pintle hook should lock securely.
Attempt to correct with lubrication during PDI.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 7.25 Replace 2 rear axle gaskets if removed by shipper

NOTE: All PROStar and LONEStar tractors are equipped with two additional new axle shaft gaskets (if needed) which can be found in the Required Documents envelope in the cab. DO NOT apply cost of gaskets to PTD 03 Warranty.
NOTE: Labor to replace gaskets as well as lube cleanup is included in PDI. DO NOT apply to PTD Warranty.
NOTE: Labor and materials for reinstallation of backed-out hub studs is covered within the PDI. DO NOT apply to PTD Warranty.

NOTE:Rearmost axle shaft gaskets replaced during PDI by the PDI facility are not eligible for In-Service (01) Warranty. Parts and labor costs for repair of leaking dealer installed gaskets (at PDI) are the responsibility of the facility performing the PDI/ party replacing the original gasket at PDI.

item.para: Determine if the axle shaft gasket is leaking or is not leaking but has evidence of axle removal from the rearmost drive axle during vehicle transport. Indications that an axle shaft has been removed may include:
The axle shaft flange and or its fasteners may have scratched or chipped paint.
The axle hub and/or wheel rim may have evidence of axle lubricant that has dripped onto them.
NOTE: IF THE REARMOST AXLE SHOWS NO EVIDENCE OF HAVING ITS AXLE SHAFTS REMOVED, DO NOT REPLACE THE AXLE SHAFT GASKETS. ACCEPT AS-IS AND MOVE TO NEXT LINE ITEM.

If a rearmost axle shaft is leaking or is not leaking but has evidence of axle removal, the dealer is to install a new axle shaft flange gasket on both ends of the axle using the following specific procedures:
Make sure the Dif-Lock (if present) has been engaged to avoid axle shaft-to-differential misalignment upon axle shaft reinsertion.
Remove the right and left axle shafts on the suspect axle. Be sure not to allow the axle shaft to touch any dirty surfaces.
Wipe clean and inspect the axle shaft flange and wheel hub machined mating surfaces for damage.
If damage is found, document items to be repaired on PDI Report.
If any studs are found to have backed out of the hub, be sure to use a thread-locking liquid on the inserted section of the threads before reinstallation and install to the correct depth.
Place the new axle flange gasket over the hub studs and fully seat it against the hub.
Carefully reinstall the axle shaft, and make sure not to nick the new gasket. If damage occurs, install a new gasket.
Snug the axle flange fasteners with a hand operated wrench. DO NOT USE AN IMPACT WRENCH AS IT CAN DAMAGE THE GASKET AND CAUSE A LEAK!
Tighten the nuts in steps in a star pattern with a torque wrench to the specified torque. Refer to the Table below.
Wipe off any visible axle lubricant.

table.title: Axle Flange Nut and Bolt Torque Chart

svcproc.para: 7.30 Axle Flange Nuts - retorque (see Torque Chart above)
7.35 Drive Axle Oil Level FULL (all drive axles)

item.para: Verify vehicle is on level ground. If not, move vehicle to level ground.
Verify that oil level in all Drive Axle(s) is at the bottom of the fill plug opening.
Allow an overfilled Drive Axle to drain excess fluid.
Add fluid as needed.
NOTE: Be sure to top off with the correct fluid type (synthetic/ conventional mineral oil) per Lineset Ticket, Job Information Sheet, or label on fill plug.
Verify that the fill plug and the drain plug are torqued to spec. and leak-free.

note.para: Labor is covered within PDI. Fluid added is covered under PTD Warranty.

svcproc.para: 7.40 Drive Axle Oil Level within 1/8" (3 mm) of fill plug opening

item.para: Verify vehicle is on level ground. If not, move vehicle to level ground.
Verify that oil level in all Drive Axle(s) is at or within 1/8 inch (3 mm) of the bottom of the fill plug opening.
NOTE: Fluid level is acceptable if fluid level is not more than 1/8 inch (3 mm) below the bottom of the fill hole opening. Further fluid additions are not covered by PTD Warranty.

If the fluid is more than 1/8 inch (3 mm) below the bottom of the fill plug opening, add more fluid until the oil is filled level with the bottom of the fill plug opening. (Labor covered within PDI. Fluid covered under PTD 03 Warranty.)
Allow an overfilled Drive Axle to drain excess fluid.
Add fluid as needed.
NOTE: Be sure to top off with the correct fluid type (synthetic/ conventional mineral oil) per Lineset Ticket, Job Information Sheet, or label on fill plug.
Verify that the fill plug and the drain plug are torqued to spec. and leak-free.

note.para: Labor is covered within PDI. Fluid added is covered under PTD Warranty.

svcproc.para: 7.45 Wheel Lug Nuts - retorque to 450 - 500 lb-ft

item.para: Check torque on all wheel mounting nuts
Torque should be 450 - 500 lb-ft (610 - 678 Nm).

svcproc.para: 7.50 Front Wheel Lug Nuts - retorque 450 - 500 lb-ft

note.para: Re-torque is required on Front Wheels only since some front wheels are removed during vehicle transport. Re-torque of rear wheels is not included in PDI.

item.para: Turn front wheels slightly to the right to provide clearance between the torque wrench handle and the side of the vehicle to reduce the chances of scratching the vehicle bodywork.
Determine nut size, type, and torque specification.
Re-torque all wheel rim nuts following the proper tightening sequence.
Refer to the Wheels, Rims, and Tires section in GROUP 17 of the Master Service Manual or the appropriate Operator's Manual for additional information.

note.para: Do not use lubrication on dry threads.

svcproc.para: 7.55 Tires - proper inflation, valve stem caps are tight

note.para: Tires may come from the vendor inflated above the maximum pressure indicated on the sidewall.

item.para: Tire pressure should be checked with a pressure gauge that is calibrated at least 4 times per year.
An air tire valve chuck with an integral dial pressure gage will speed up this process.

Typically, rear/ drive tires should be inflated to the same pressure between 90 psi and the "MAX LOAD DUAL" tire pressure listed on the sidewall, and all rear/ drive tires should be within 10 psi of each other. Use these specs unless the end user has requested a special tire pressure.
Front tires should be inflated to the "MAX LOAD SINGLE" tire pressure listed on the sidewall + 5 / -5 PSI.
Correct tire pressure as needed during PDI
Re-install metal valve stem caps tightly.
If one or more tires of a like kind is more than 15 PSI lower in pressure than the other tires of like kind, document tire(s) to be inspected for slow leaks on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 7.60 Front Hub \and/or Lift Axle Oil Level - in range

item.para: Oil level on oil filled front hubs should be between indicators.
Add or remove appropriate oil as needed to bring level to the indicator circle on the hub.

note.para: If fluid level is in acceptable operating range, further fluid additions are not covered by PTD Warranty. Only fluid added, not labor, is covered by PTD Warranty.

svcproc.para: 7.65 Cab Tilt / Assist / Latch / Lockout Mechanisms

item.para: Cab should tilt smoothly, easily, quietly.
Cab tilt lock-out should work properly
First latch works properly - catch and release.
Secondary latch works properly - catch and release.
Mechanism latches cab firmly.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 7.70 Compartments - keys, latches, lights, hinges, aligned
For all Battery/ Electrical/ Luggage/ Fuel Fill/ Engine Access/ Skirts/ APU/ Etc. Compartments:

item.para: Door and Latch open and close fully and easily.
Latch is adjusted to hold door tightly closed with no rattling, but not so tight that it makes it difficult to latch/unlatch.
Key locks/unlocks lock if lock is present.
Check function of all compartment lights.
Light(s) turn on and off with door open/close if so designed.
Free from other obvious defects.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 7.75 Cab Extenders and Skirts - secure, alignment

item.para: Cab extenders and Chassis Skirts should be properly aligned and securely mounted.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 7.80 Cab Ride Height - re-attach linkage

note.para: The cab air bag(s) may not inflate if there is not at least 110 PSI air pressure on both air pressure gages on the dashboard.

item.para: If the truck has a wooden block supporting the cab, remove it.
Reconnect the height control valve linkage.

NOTE: It should not be necessary to adjust the height after the linkage is connected. The height valve linkage should not be disassembled or the locknut (if applicable) loosened. It should have been merely disconnected at one of its mounting points thus maintaining its proper length set at the factory.
NOTE: Measuring or resetting the cab height is not covered under PDI.
Document items to be repaired/ missing parts on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 9.10 Tow Hooks / Loops / Pins - present, secure

item.para: Tow hooks should be securely mounted to the frame.
If tow hooks are removable, frame mount must be securely mounted to frame.
If tow hooks are removable, tow hooks must be secure in their storage area.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 9.20 Remove Protective Coverings, Tags, Tape

item.para: Remove protective coatings from entire vehicle except for plastic seat covers.
Remove any adhesives left behind after protective coatings are removed.
Document items to be repaired on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 9.30 External Paint, Exterior components - condition, fit

item.para: Remove any protective coatings added for shipping.
External painted/unpainted and plated surfaces should be free from runs, scratches, scuffs, dents, bumps, holes, or other obvious defects.
Hood and trim pieces should be securely affixed and aligned, and in good condition.
Chrome surfaces should be free from cracks, bubbles, scuffs, or other obvious defects.
Mirrors, Bumper and Chassis Skirts should be securely mounted and in good condition.
Document items to be corrected and any other body damage on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 9.31 External Paint, Components - condition, fit per B9.31
General guidelines in addition to Bus Inspection Spec B9.31:

item.para: Remove any protective coatings added for shipping.
External painted/unpainted and plated surfaces should be free from runs, scratches, scuffs, dents, bumps, holes, or other obvious defects.
Hood and trim pieces should be securely affixed and aligned, and in good condition.
Chrome surfaces should be free from cracks, bubbles, scuffs, or other obvious defects.
Mirrors, Bumper and Chassis Skirts should be securely mounted and in good condition.
Document items to be corrected and any other body damage on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 9.40 Windshield and glass - no damage

item.para: Windshield and other glass should be free from cracks, stars, chips, or other obvious defects.
Document items to be corrected on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 9.50 Hood Fit - secured, good alignment

item.para: Hood should be properly aligned with cab, lower fender extensions, and bumper.
Hood latches should be easily operated.
Document items to be corrected on PDI Report.

warning.para: Always chock the wheels before manually releasing the parking brakes, otherwise the vehicle could roll, causing property damage, personal injury, or death.

svcproc.para: AIR BRAKE SYSTEMS:

item.para: Low Pressure Alarm turns off
Assure vehicle will not roll, using chocks, and then release Park Brake and Service Brakes.

With the key switch in the OFF position, the light must be off. The pressure reading in at least one air pressure gage must be below 55 psi. If necessary, cycle service brake pedal until the system pressure in both air pressure gages drops below 55 psi.
Turn the key switch to the ON position. The low air pressure light and or buzzer must be on when the air pressure is below 55 psi.
Start the engine and let it run. The light and buzzer must go off once the pressure readings in the air pressure gage with the lowest reading is between 55 and 76 psi.
Pressure Build
Rev engine to maximum RPM. Pressure should build from 85 - 100 psi in 25 seconds or less.
Governor should cut out at an air pressure gage reading of 115 to 135 psi.
Pressure Bleed
Turn OFF engine, switch key to ON position, release service brake.
Air pressure reading in either air pressure gage should drop no more than 2 psi in one minute .
Fully apply and hold service brake pedal.
Air pressure reading in either air pressure gage should drop no more than 3 psi in one minute.
Low Pressure Alarm
Cycle service brake pedal to deplete air pressure.
Alarm must sound if the reading in either air pressure gage drops to 55 to 76 psi.
Park Brake Application
Continue cycling service brake pedal to deplete air pressure
Park brake must apply when the reading in air pressure gage #2 drops to 20 to 40 psi.
Document items to be corrected on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: FULL POWER SYSTEMS:

item.para: With the key switch in the OFF position the park brake and brake pressure lights should be off. The system may have enough stored fluid pressure to apply the brakes without starting the motor. With the key switch in OFF position the motor should operate (audible pumping sound is heard) when the brake pedal is pressed. If it does not, cycle (apply and release) the brake pedal, up to a maximum of 10 times, until the motor starts. (If the motors do not start when pedal is cycled and key is OFF, there is most likely a problem with the brake light switch in the master cylinder, or there may be a communication problem with the ESC.) The motor will operate until hydraulic pressure has been built in the accumulators.
Brake pressure buzzer should sound and brake pressure light should stay on until acceptable pressure (approximately 1500 psi) is built in accumulators.
The motors must turn off once cut-out pressure is reached.
Engage the park brake if it is not already set, and turn the key switch to ON. The park brake light must turn on.
Start the engine and let it run. The park brake light should remain on since the park brake is still set.
Press the brake pedal and disengage the park brake. The park brake light must go off.
Document items to be corrected on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: HYDROMAX SYSTEMS:

item.para: With the key switch in OFF position the park brake light should be off. The brake motor will operate (audible) when the brake pedal is pressed.
Engage the park brake and turn the key switch to ON. The park brake light must go on. The motor should operate continuously.
Start the engine and let it run. The brake motor must turn off. The park brake light will remain on since the park brake is still set.
Press the brake pedal and disengage the park brake. The park brake light must go off.
Document items to be corrected on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: 17.43 Engine, Transmission, Brakes, Steering - performance

item.para: The following characteristics should be considered:
Idle quality - smooth
Acceleration - smooth and powerful; Accelerator Pedal operates smoothly.
Shifts:
Manual Trans - Smooth quiet operation of clutch and gear shift lever, shifts crisp but not harsh
Automated Manual Trans - Smooth quiet operation of clutch, auto-shifts crisp but not harsh
Automatic Trans - shifts crisp but not harsh
NVH (Noise, Vibration, and Harshness) - smooth and quiet, no shuddering, squeaking, buzzing, hissing, whining.
Braking (Service Brakes, Retarder, and Engine/ Exhaust Brake) - smooth and powerful
Steering - Tight and straight, no pull or vibration
Oil Pressure - 25 - 50 psi, engine warm

Add coolant only if outside this range.

warning.para: To avoid being scalded by hot coolant, wait until engine cools and then slowly unscrew surge tank cap if necessary.

svcproc.para: NOTE: Use a 50/50 mix of coolant and water or a 50/50 pre-mix..

svcproc.para: 21.80 Wash, Vacuum, and Dry Vehicle - look for interior leaks*
*For buses, rather than searching for water leaks, verify document is present, verifying that vehicle passed factory rain leak test.

caution.para: Do not wipe dirt off the vehicle when it is dry as that can scratch the finish.

item.para: Assure the vehicle is clean inside and out and no dirt or trash is visible.
Wash vehicle (add mild soap solution if necessary) using cloth or soft clean brush.
NOTE: Give extra attention to wheels that have had axle oil on them due to the axle being removed during delivery.
Rinse thoroughly with fresh water.
Starting with the windows, dry the vehicle fully with a soft clean towel to prevent water spots and soap etching.
Using mild soap solution, remove any dirt that has entered the cab/ interior.
Clean inside of windows with glass cleaner.
Clean floor mat using a vacuum. Clean floor mat with soap, sponge, brush, and towel if necessary to eliminate all signs of dirt. Make sure all signs of visible glue are removed.
Remove any protective coverings from interior unless the final customer desires them to remain.
Verify there are no water leaks into the interior or vehicle has documentation to prove it has successfully passed a previous water spray booth test.
Document items to be corrected on PDI Report.

svcproc.para: NOTE: Remember to remove any Dealer-owned, temporary License Plates from the vehicle. Check to make sure all tools and supplies have been removed from the vehicle.
